title: Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) Registration in India

sections.heading: What is LLP Registration?
content: A Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) is a legally recognized business structure that combines the flexibility of a partnership with the benefit of limited liability protection.
Governed by the LLP Act, 2008, an LLP is a separate legal entity, meaning partners are not personally liable for business debts or losses beyond their agreed contribution.

sections.heading: Why Choose LLP for Your Business?

points: Limited liability protection for all partners
Lower compliance burden compared to Private Limited Companies
Ideal for service-based and professional businesses
No limit on number of partners
One designated partner must be a resident of India
Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) for designated partners

list.title: For Partners
points: Address proof (utility bill or bank statement)

list.title: For Registered Office
points: Utility bill (electricity or water bill not older than 2 months)
No Objection Certificate (NOC) from the property owner
Step 1: Collect partner and office documents
Step 2: Obtain Digital Signature Certificate (DSC) and DPIN
Step 3: Apply for LLP name approval with MCA
Step 5: Draft and file LLP Agreement within 30 days
7 to 15 working days (subject to government approval)

sections.heading: Comparison: LLP vs Private Limited vs Partnership Firm

rows: Only if turnover exceeds ₹40 lakhs or capital exceeds ₹25 lakhs
Taxed as a firm (30% flat rate)

points: Is LLP registration mandatory? Yes, registration with MCA is mandatory.
Can LLP have only two partners? Yes, two is the minimum requirement.
Is GST registration compulsory for LLP? Only if turnover exceeds threshold or business requires it.
Can LLP be converted into Private Limited Company? Yes, conversion is allowed.
Do partners have personal liability? No, liability is limited to contribution.
